meanings.definition: A mass or collection of things gathered together.
meanings.sent1: The agglomerates of colorful leaves covered the ground in the park.
meanings.sent2: The agglomerates of students waiting for the bus created a crowded scene.
meanings.sent3: The agglomerates of toys in the playroom seemed to have a party of their own.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an agglomerates of memories, all jumbled together.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting was an agglomerates of vibrant colors, blending beautifully.

meanings.definition: To form into a cluster or mass.
meanings.sent1: She carefully agglomerates the ingredients to make a delicious soup.
meanings.sent2: The clouds agglomerates in the sky, signaling an upcoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The children agglomerates around the storyteller, eager to hear the tale.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts agglomerates into a brilliant idea for the project.
meanings.sent5: The ants agglomerates to carry the food back to their nest efficiently.

meanings.definition: A rock composed of fragments or particles.
meanings.sent1: The geologist found an interesting agglomerates during the expedition.
meanings.sent2: The agglomerates on the mountain slope showed signs of erosion.
meanings.sent3: The agglomerates on the beach resembled a mosaic of different colors.
meanings.sent4: The agglomerates in the quarry were rich in minerals.
meanings.sent5: The agglomerates in the riverbed were smooth from years of water flow.
